intro: Chorizanthe virgata var. tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly chori, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
